str2: And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cause to increase, become greater (b) I increase, grow. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to grow, i.e. Enlarge.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A number, total. From airo; a number.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To increase, multiply. From another form of plethos; to increase.
Exceedingly, greatly, very much. Neuter plural of sphodros as adverb; vehemently, i.e. In a high degree, much.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
Much, many; often.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A priest, one who offers sacrifice to a god (in Jewish and pagan religions; of Christians only met.). From hieros; a priest.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From hupo and akouo; to hear under, i.e. To listen attentively; by implication, to heed or conform to a command or authority.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
